DOC.brief_summary: Interview pregnant and lactating mothers in the Gainesville, FL area to optimize; clinical study recruitment and retention, patient-centered outcomes, and stool collection procedures.
DOC.brief_title: The BEACH Study- Interviews With Pregnant and Lactating Women
DOC.detailed_description: This is an interview study that will enroll mothers during 26 weeks or greater of pregnancy and lactating mothers less than 1 year. The focus of the interviews will assess recruitment, patient-centered outcomes, and stool collection procedures via individualized interviews and data collection. Participants will be recruited from the greater North Central Florida area. Data collection will include questionnaires/surveys as well as minimal risk non-invasive biological samples such as stool, human milk, saliva, vaginal swab, and urine collection. Participants will be seen at the University of Florida Clinical and Translational Science Institute.
DOC.criteria: Females 18>45, between 2638 weeks pregnant, anticipating delivery are area hospitals, live in Florida, and committed to exclusively breastfeeding. Females 18>45, activity lactating for <12 months, committed to exclusive breastfeeding. Living in Florida Smoking Preeclampsia History of preterm delivery (<35 weeks) Only one breast capable of lactation and milk production inadequate Any maternal antibiotics in the last 2 weeks during delivery Any alcohol consumption Drug use
